Text: Preserve me, O God, for in You I take refuge.
Context: David seeks God's protection, expressing trust and dependency.

Text: I said to the LORD, 'You are my Lord; apart from You I have no good thing.'
Context: Acknowledgment of the LORD's sovereignty and the source of all goodness.

Text: As for the saints in the land, they are the glorious ones in whom is all my delight.
Context: Affirmation of the value and joy found in the fellowship of the saints.

Text: The sorrows of those will increase who run after other gods. I will not pour out their libations of blood or speak their names with my lips.
Context: Warning against idolatry and a commitment to not partake in its practices.

Text: LORD, You alone are my portion and my cup; You make my lot secure.
Context: Declaration of contentment in God's provision and protection.

Text: The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely I have a delightful inheritance.
Context: Gratitude for the favorable conditions and blessings provided by God.

Text: I will bless the LORD who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me.
Context: Appreciation for God's guidance and the internalization of His principles.

Text: I have set the LORD always before me. Because He is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.
Context: Expression of steadfast trust in God's presence and support.

Text: Therefore my heart is glad and my glory rejoices; my flesh also will dwell securely.
Context: Jubilation in the security and happiness that comes from trusting God.

Text: For You will not abandon my soul to Sheol, nor will You let Your Holy One see decay.
Context: Hope in the promise of resurrection and eternal life, a prophetic reference to Christ.

Text: You make known to me the path of life; in Your presence there is fullness of joy; at Your right hand there are pleasures forevermore.
Context: Proclamation of the joy and fulfillment found in God's guidance and eternal presence.
